page.title: 08CALF HEATH VILLAGE
page.content: Calf Heath is a small village lying midway between junctions ll and l2 of the M6.The major factor bringing change to the village was the opening of the M6 over 2O years ago,the long term results of which are only now apparent. Close proximity to the M6 makes the area very appealing to families wishing to live in the country and commute to Birmingham.As this area is designated green belt no new building is allowed, consequently over the years as old farm cottages have become vacant these have been purchased at inflated prices by property speculators,almost knocked down and then re-built as luxury modern houses thus changing the character of the village.The price of these are beyond the means of most local couples who are forced to leave the village when marrying and buying a home.
